item.title: "Come, is this the first time in Pyeongchang Bakery?" Pyeongchang Winter Olympics D-100, Pyeongchang Bread Flavor - Pyeongchang-gun, Gangwon, South Korea
item.description:
Local Food Cafe 'Coro Bay'

"Come, is this the first time in Pyeongchang Bakery?" Pyeongchang Winter Olympics D-100, Pyeongchang Bread Flavor

Pyeongchang-gun, Gangwon, South Korea

Not long ago a mail came from Canada. Pennies, Caroline and Janice, who live in Vancouver, visit Korea this winter. To see the 2018 Pyeongchang Winter Olympics. Also different from those who live in winter sports. I came to Korea to see the Winter Olympics… .
As a result, November 1 is the day of the D-100 Winter Olympics. It felt so far, but it is not too long now. After receiving mail from my friends, I also prepared to welcome guests. I picked a list of places to visit and things to see and do in Pyeongchang.
Vegetarian Bakery 'Nanda Bakery'
Once you decide what to eat, the guidebook is complete! What do you eat? The famous Sanchae meal, Osam Bulgogi, Hanwoo grilled, and buckwheat dishes are good in Pyeongchang. A few years ago, there weren't many bakeries that stood out.
Bread made with buckwheat
But what a girl. Last week I went to Pyeongchang for exploration and autumn leaves and found some bakeries I would like to show off to my foreign friends. Eureka! I want to brag to my kids soon. Three people three colors, Pyeongchang bakery list to shoot their tastes are released.
Type A: Vegan interested in trekking and cultural heritage → Nanda Bakery
Penny always enjoys trekking in Canada. A naturalist and healthist, she is a vegetarian who likes to walk in the mountains. It is the most vegan of any vegetarian diet. Vegan doesn't eat meat, or dairy products like eggs, milk, and cheese. I found the perfect place for her. It is 'Nanda Bakery' located in Odaesan Woljeongsa. Since it is a temple operated by thorough vegetarianism. Do not use butter, milk or eggs at all. Organic wheat flour and domestic whole wheat are used, and other ingredients are selected with domestic priority.
Elegant bakery in Woljeongsa
Nanda and bakery bread is made tricky. First of all, it is operated by a large temple called Woljeongsa Temple. Since the monk must be edible bread, it is based on the principle of temple food. Make bread that is beneficial to your body rather than deceptive bread and focus on honest and healthy tastes rather than profits. The bread maker also puts healthy bread first. He has been in the baking industry for a long time, and he is more sensitive to bread ingredients because he suffers from atopy and skin allergies. Also his wife is vegan. As the couple make bread that they can eat, they are bound to be more thorough.
Don't use milk, eggs, or butter
Nandana Bakery is simple. Not many kinds of bread come out in one day. The bread is not gorgeous either. The ingredients for bread are also simple. Release materials one by one with confidence. The bread is more faithful to the inside than the outer packaging. You can see just one soboro bread. There are many hands, but you can also make toppings with sobo. Mix ground peanut and pistachios with coconut oil. It's very different from ordinary soboro bread toppings made with butter, peanut butter, sugar and eggs.
Kindly tell me the ingredients for the bread
This is the case for all breads in Nanda and Bakery. Healthy and delicious breads, such as cakes made with vegetarian cream, home-grown red beans and red bean bread made from fermented yeast. Next to the bakery is a cafe and a cafe. You can buy bread and eat it with a drink at a tea house or cafe. The fine mountain landscape is a bonus. Penny is sure to be surprised that there is such a nice bakery in the mountains of Gangwon-do.
Bread seasoned with healthy and honest ingredients
<Fun next to bakery> Odaesan Woljeongsa & Seonjae-gil
Nanda bakery is attractive enough for the vegetarian penny, but the surroundings are a bonus. It adds a quiet promenade to the landscape of Korean mountain temple that foreigners will love. In the mountain sheltered courtyard, there is a octagonal pagoda of Pyeongchang Woljeongsa, National Treasure No. 48-1. The mountain, the temple, and the tower are combined to complete an oriental painting.
Autumn landscape in Woljeongsa
If you walk to the fir forest road and Seonjae-gil, you will be ecstatic. The 9km-long Seonjae-gil, which runs from Woljeongsa Temple to Sangwonsa Temple, is beautiful in autumn with beautiful colored leaves. So even during the Pyeongchang Winter Olympics, you can enjoy the charm.
Seonjae-gil in autumn
Type B: Ski enthusiasts & local food lovers → Corobay
Caroline is a skier. I live in Vancouver, but in winter, I live in a family cottage in Whistler. She is also a local food lover. The reason she was forced to become a local food lover was because of global warming. Feeling that Canada's winter has been changing for some time, she began to do small things she could do to prevent global warming, and one of them is local food. Local food is not only good for health by consuming fresh local produce, but it also has a positive impact on the environment as it reduces food miles (the distance from which produce is brought to the consumer's table) to reduce CO2 emissions.
Corobay exterior with containers
The moment I saw 'Coro Bay', I thought it was the perfect place for her. The name of the store is completely local. 'Korobay', which is also a foreign language, is a dialect of Pyeongchang-gun Bongpyeong. The husband and wife are also born and raised in Bongpyeong. Corobay is a local food café, where all ingredients are local produce first. Potatoes, sweet potatoes, and various vegetables are grown directly in the garden.
There are many windows inside Coro Bay, so you can enjoy the scenery.
Order a homemade burger set, one of our top menus. Burger patty is made directly from Pyeongchang Hanwoo and Handon. The French fries in the set menu are impressive. It's not French Fries that you had at a traditional hamburger shop. The shape of the dongle is different. The owner cuts and fry the potatoes grown in the garden at the same time as the order. It is lightly seasoned with Gourmet Salt and you can taste the authentic taste of potatoes in Gangwon-do.
Korobay's signature burger
There are various local food menus such as pasta made with buckwheat noodles, potato cream pasta made with potatoes in Gangwon-do, and ginger milk tea dipped in domestic hat ginger. It also sells natural fermented bread to accompany with tea. Bread is taken from a nearby bakery. Bread may be accompanied by jam, or apples or sweet potatoes harvested from the yard. Food ingredients grown close to 'Food Mile 0' are the basics, so it's a good choice for your health and the environment.
Introducing a variety of local food menus
<Things to Do next to Cafe> Phoenix Pyeongchang
Another reason for Caroline's applause for Coro Bay is the ski resort Phoenix Pyeongchang next door. Phoenix Snow Park is also the official venue of the PyeongChang Winter Olympics, where snowboarding and freestyle skiing are held.
Phoenix Pyeongchang, the official venue of the Pyeongchang Winter Olympics
So it would be an attractive place for her who loves winter sports. I'm happy to see the Winter Olympics and ski.
Autumn scenery
Type C: Local Specialties Who Love Market Trips → Bread Buckwheat
Janice loves cooking and traveling. Whenever she travels around the world, she finds her local market first. Janice says the market is the perfect place to understand the local culture. Her hobby is finding and tasting local specialties at the market and cooking. 'Brew buckwheat' is a small bakery I would definitely recommend to her.
Breaded buckwheat on one side of the market
Bread buckwheat is run by a sibling from Pyeongchang and, as the name implies, uses 100% domestic buckwheat. In Pyeongchang and Jeju Island, I am buckwheat. Choi Hyo-ju, the baker's president, got a buckwheat bread idea from a friend from Canada a few years ago. When a Canadian friend stayed in Korea and went home, he wanted to buy buckwheat, a specialty of Pyeongchang. If you take buckwheat alone, food utilization will decrease. Seeing a friend's favorite buckwheat cookies are also delicious, I decided to make bread with buckwheat, a local specialty.
The sister in charge of bread (Hyo Joo Choi) and her brother in charge of tea and coffee
The bakery is small but there are various kinds of bread on the stand. Five-day bread, treasure chest, and goblin are interesting names. Bread ingredients are nice. The red beans that go into the red bean bread and the anvers are directly fried with red beans from Pyeongchang To complement the cold nature of red beans, use locally grown ginger. Use high quality local ingredients, such as cheese and milk from nearby ranches and cherry tomatoes from nearby farms.
Bread of various buckwheat
When you enter the store, you can see the phrase 'you can taste the hot bread only if you make a baker's owner'. Choi Hyo-ju, who has a good feeling, often offers sliced hot bread to people who visit the shop. Sit back for a moment and enjoy the warmth of a rural bakery with the bread made by your sister Choi Hyo-ju in a coffee from your brother Choi Seung-soo. The smell of people with the bread fills the space. If you visit Bread Buckwheat this winter, the space will be different. The bakery and tea drinking area are separated. The bakery is moved to the store next door, and now the bakery is transformed into a tea specialty shop run by Mr. Choi. 'Hyo-joo's bakery and' Soo-soo's tea shop will be side by side.
The owner, Hyo-joo Choi, makes the guests taste hot bread.
<Play next to bakery> Pyeongchang Olympic Market

Bread Buckwheat is located in the Pyeongchang Olympic Market (formerly Pyeongchang Traditional Market). You can enjoy the taste of Korean traditional market and taste buckwheat buckwheat, a specialty of Pyeongchang. Putting pure buckwheat flour dough and cabbage leaves on a pot lid pan and slicing it thinly provides interesting things for foreigners. With various buckwheat beaks and local specialties made with buckwheat, visitors to Pyeongchang are well worth a visit.

I'm already waiting. This winter. This is because they come to Canada to be surprised at the taste of Pyeongchang. Come on, guys. Is this your first time in Pyeongchang? Isn't the scenery and taste of Pyeongchang amazing?

Pyeongchang Olympic Market, where you can taste delicious buckwheat

item.title: Jeongseon-gun, Gangwon, South Korea - Pyeongchang Sightseeing Road 08, which is previewed in advance, takes you to Untan Altitude, an old road carrying coal
item.description:
Untan Altitude at high altitudes of more than 1,100 meters above sea level

Pyeongchang Sightseeing Road 08, which is previewed in advance, takes you to Untan Altitude, an old road carrying coal

Jeongseon-gun, Gangwon, South Korea

<Travel Course>
High1 Ski Resort Mountain Gondola

→ Untan Altitude → Samtan Art Mine

→ Taebaek Cheoram Coal History Village

The Sabuk and Gohan regions of Jeongseon, Gangwon-do, were Korea's representative coal mining sites. When the coal industry boomed in the 1970's and 1980's, money was overflowing enough to say that dogs carry ten thousand won. However, in 1989, the coal industry walked down due to the rationalization policy of the abandoned mine and production cuts. As the coal mine disappeared, the mining villages of Sabuk and Gohan were devastated. Like the words `` Sae-ji-ma '', they rose to coal and stagnated to coal. Now, Sabuk and Gohan are rising again with tourism based on coal. Along the fascinating coal mine attractions, we look forward to the past, present and future of Jeongseon.

The center of Jeongseon Coal Mine Trip is Untan Altitude. Reminiscent of China's Chama Island, this road used to carry coal from Manhangjae to Hambaek Station. Trekking on the Untan Altitude requires time and stamina as it is the only mountain trail in Korea to be built at high altitudes of more than 1,100 meters. But don't be scared before you start. Because there is an easy way to climb. The mountain gondola (2832m) of High1 Ski Resort is used.
Gondolas are the easiest means of access to Untan Altitude.
Gondola from Mountain Base to Mountain Top takes 20 minutes to the summit. Don't think of a gondola as a simple means of transportation. It is also a moving observatory. Skiing, Gangwon Land and Baekdudaegan are spread under your feet while riding the gondola. The slopes on the ski slopes are filled with summer wildflowers such as daisies and lions. The ridges of Baekdudaegan are pushed like waves to create spectacular scenery. You can enjoy the scenery from the gondola that you can't see without climbing the high mountains.
Gondola to the top of the mountain

Once you've climbed the mountain top, you don't have to head straight to Untan Altitude. Surrounded by a rustic colony of wildflowers. A shy flower blooms in the wind and sends out a gesture of temptation. The mountain trails behind the wildflower community make it a mountain country.
There is more to see. High1 Alpine Botanical Garden is located at the top of the mountain at 1380m above sea level. In the highest botanical garden in Korea, 330 species of alpine plants are classified into themes such as Manbyeongwon, Alpine Grass Garden, Rock Garden, Sink Garden, and Wildflower Garden.

Wildflowers bloom below the gondola
Time to trek to the full-scale Untango. You can meet Untan Altitude at the top of the mountain by 1.4km down the mountain porch behind the observatory. From here, take the road to High1 Hotel, Manhangjae. It's a bit uphill, but the road is flat and smooth, making walking easy. Taebaek's spirits take off while walking for two and a half hours.
Skyway from Uncle Altitude to the summit
As it is the only mountain in Korea, it is a mountain path that leads to highlands and ridges that are more than 1,000 meters above sea level. The reason why Untan Altitude is special is that the beautiful landscape contains the history of the coal industry. The old road that carried coal. When the Hambaek Station was opened in 1957, about 2000 construction workers made shovels and pickaxes to transport coal.
In the past, coal chambers used trucks
The 1177 gang that meets during the trek is an acid witness to the coal industry. The 1177 gang, which was first opened in the area by Dongwon Sabuk Mining Co., Ltd., has restored the entrance of the mine. Hanging on the shaft, a wooden structure that supports the shaft, also hangs the oysters that the miners hung to die.
1177 Gang Entrance at Untan Altitude
For half a century, a truck loaded with coal flew black dust, creating a trail that Gangwon Land combined with the history of coal mines. The busy roads of the trucks became heavenly paths with hundreds of wild flowers growing on them. It also meant 'high roads with clouds spread like rugs'.
The road is flat and smooth and easy to walk.
In addition to Untango Island, there are several promenades called Skyway. There is a squirrel, a hare, a deer, and an elk course, and each course has a name that shows the characteristics of the section, such as Sky Mae-gil, Mountain Bamboo Road, Mt. Unless you're on a coal-themed trip, you can walk on the sky and breathe with nature.
A camellia flower at Untan Altitude
If you are curious about the actual appearance of the coal mine, Samtan Artmine will solve that question.
Samtan Art Mine has been reborn as an art space
This place is special in that it uses the actual abandoned mine.
Sculptures in the Laundry Room
'Samtan' refers to Samcheok Coal, which was one of the representative coal mines in Korea. 'Art' and 'Mine' are derived from 'Art' and 'Mine', the English notation of art and coal mines.
A photo of miners' lives
The Samcheok coal thrust, which had been mining coal since 1964, was abandoned in October 2001, and it became a new space by combining culture and art.
Even filming the earthquake disaster scene in Descendants of the Sun
The clan chiefs and laundries, which show the miners' lives, have been transformed into wonderful exhibition halls with more than 100,000 works of art collected from 150 countries and works of contemporary art artists.
Shower room where Kang Mo-yeon was held hostage in Descendants of the Sun
If you go to Taebaek beyond the rugged mountain range in Jeongseon, traces of the heritage, life and history of the coal industry remain under the name of Cheoram Coal Mining Village.
Cheoram Coal Mining Village intact
During the prosperity of the mining village, the buildings such as Perika, Honam Super, Bonghwa Restaurant, Jinju Castle, and Hanyang Tea House, which were booming in the magpie building used by miners and their families, were made into historical villages.
The magpie bridge building with pillars in Cheoramcheon
The magpie foot building refers to the pillar, or the building that built the magpie foot, on Cheoramcheon. It is a building that many people can live in a small area.
Exhibit showing the life of miners
Signboards and crumbling buildings of old faded shops welcome travelers by transforming them into galleries and exhibition rooms where miners live and experience contemporary art.
A statue of a miner's wife who sees her husband off to work
There are lots of interesting things to see from the records of the miners' living notices and records of the residents who recorded the personal information of the residents, as well as the exhibits recreating various household goods and iron alleys used at the time.
If you climb the observatory, you can see the Cheoram Coal Mine.
Coal mines piled up like mountains are still in the coal mine across the street. The Cheoram Coal Mining Cousin is a space where you can meet the old look of coal mine more vividly than the coal museum made of billions of dollars.
Coal miner statue built in Cheoram coal mining cousin

Recommended trip: family, friends

traditional market
Jeongseon Arirang Market
In addition to Jeongseon's agricultural products, wild vegetables from the mountains can be purchased at low prices. There is a tasting corner like a supermarket, so you can taste and buy it There are a lot of old foods such as sorghum buckwheat noodles and scampi noodles. You can also watch the Jeongseon Arirang drama, a traditional performance, at the performance hall located in the market.
-Address: 58-1 Bibong-ro, Jeongseon-eup, Jeongseon-gun
Opening Hours: Permanent Market 9: 00 ~ 20: 00, Closed every Saturday


Jeongseon City Tour
-Journey to look around the core destination of choice. Depart from Mountain Condo at High1 Resort every week from 11am to 11am. It is closed on Mondays and Tuesdays, but operates on oil days or public holidays. You can also board at Mindongsan Station (11:30) and Jeongseon Station (12:25). 50% discount when you present your KORAIL Free Pass. Contact 1644-9053
<Day of the day> Jeongseon 5 Days → Jeongseon Arirang Drama → Hwaam Cave (or Hwaam Yaksu → Gimba Rock Art Village) → Gangwon Land
<Secret day> Jeongseon 5-day Workshop → Skywalk → Ararichon → Hwaam Cave (or Hwaam Yaksu → Gimbawi Art Village) → Gangwon Land

item.title: Jeongseon-gun, Gangwon, South Korea - 2018 Pyeongchang Tourist Road 09, Jeongseon Journey along Arirang Song
item.description:
Auraji, the birthplace of Jeongseon Arari

2018 Pyeongchang Tourist Road 09, Jeongseon Journey along Arirang Song

Jeongseon-gun, Gangwon, South Korea

<Travel Course>
Auraji → Rail Bike

→ Ariari Village → Arirang Market

→ Scenic Walkway Observatory, Straw Wire

"Ari and Ari and Ariari. Ari and pass me over your head." Arirang melodies are melted in Jeongseon. Arirang, which is called at the lowest point of life, is intimately attached to our lives and narrates love, farewell, coalition, and lament. The vibrancy of life at the Jeongseon Arirang Market and the sound of the river flowing with the rail bike are like the rhythm of Arirang. Step on the rail bike pedals to follow Arirang's faults and ride a straw wire to Jeongseon, where you can embrace the Korean peninsula.
Journey starts at Auraji, the birthplace of Arirang. Auraji is named after Songcheon and Goljicheon. The two fabrics combine to form a river from the Auraji, the highest point of the Han River. Surrounded by mountains and boasting beautiful scenery, it is also the birthplace of Jeongseon Ari and love.
Crescent-shaped bridge that resembles a river
In the story that came down, a loved one lived between the auraji. The two promised to go to Camellia to get the camellia, but they couldn't meet because the river couldn't get up because of heavy rain. It is said that longing and sadness, "Please hand over a ship of astronaut voyeur. All the camellia falls, and camellia falls. Fallen camellia piles up. On both ends of Goljicheon, there is a bridge that looks like a stone bridge on one side and a large crescent moon on one side.
Please let me cross the boat
The Auraji is also the destination for selected rail bikes. The train stops due to the abandoned mine, and a three-car train carries locals and Jeongseon Sun stopped due to mismatch. This is where the rail bikes with tourist memories are stored. The starting point is Gujeolli Station. If you pedal hard to 7.2 km to the Aura area, you will arrive in less than an hour. Songcheon flows right next to the rail and it's not hot even if you pedal hard. It is popular because you can feel the nature of Jeongseon with your whole body.
Rail bike running on the rails with two pedals
You can go through the tunnel where the train went, and when you cross the railroad crossing, you will hear a "beep" sound and you will be able to pass safely. It's almost downhill, so it's hard to get to the Aura region at 10-20km per hour. If you take a commemorative photo in front of a natural-memorial cafe that looks like a natural monument and visit the Aura area, you don't know how to go.
From Aura area to Gujeolli Station, take a yellow line of scenic train. Two and four-seaters are available, and during summer peak seasons, tickets for the day are picked up by the stars of the sky.
Chick width with two legs, rail bike
"If the three pyeong flat screens the sky." People who select mountainous features say: How did the mountain people live? In Arari Village, you can see the good old days of Jeongseon. It's sad to think of Ariari Village as a folk village. Arari Village is a place where you can get a glimpse of the life and customs of Jeongseon, the birth of Jeongseon Arirang.
Arari Village to get a glimpse of Jeongseon's old life
Jeongseon Arirang comes to you from the moment you buy a ticket and enter into Ariari Village. Admission fee 3,000 won will be returned to Jeongseon Arirang cultural gift certificate that can be used like cash in Ara Village and Jeongseon.
You and my house in Ararie Village
When you enter Arari Village, you will find a house that recreates traditional life such as traditional waga, oyster house, nawa house, and watermill. It is not a museum where you can touch it, but it is an experience facility where you can experience pottery, crafts, and hands-on experiences at each house.
Arari Village looks like a house in the mountains
Go to Arirang Market with Jeongseon Arirang Cultural Gift Certificate received from Ariari Village. Jeongseon Arirang Market has been a permanent market since the Joseon Dynasty. On the days ending 2 and 7, the tent is crowded with oil tents outside the market. On the oil day, Arirang Sori will be held in the center of the market from 11:30 to 1:30 pm.
Jeongseon Arirang Market
There are also shops selling wild vegetables such as gondre, deodeok, and bear scents, including wild vegetables such as gourds and wild vegetables, and food alleys in Gangwon-do.
You can buy wild vegetables and herbs from Gangwon-do.
The smell of buckwheat pancake is amazed by the smell of the bustling market. In the food alley, there are buckwheat pancake, Chinese cabbage pancake, and sorghum soup, as well as representative foods of Gangwon-do.
Jujeonburi which is indispensable in Jeongseon Arirang Market
Jeongseon namul of Jeongseon is grown only over 700m above sea level.
There are a lot of main bills which can taste good choice
Jeongseon namul of Jeongseon is grown only over 700m above sea level. Nat-dung Noodles are noodles that are made by mixing half of buckwheat flour and half of flour, and like cold noodles in summer like kalguksu in winter. It's called springy noodles because it's elastic, so when you eat it, it's said to be scooped up. I pulled out the hururu noodles, and the tip of the noodles really danced.
Cool Shrimp Noodles Cool Summer Heat
Byeongchi Chi-Skywalk is an observatory suspended from a cliff at 583 meters above sea level, which is twice the height of Yeouido 63 Building. It is a place where Donggang winds around the mountain and has a view of the night islands shaped like the Korean peninsula. It is made of transparent tempered glass, so you can enjoy the feeling of walking while floating on the scenery under your feet. Although tempered glass can be dangerous if people are too crowded, limit the number of people sent in. Wearing overshoes to protect the tempered glass from scratching, a cool breeze blows up when you climb the Skywalk. The village looks like far away from the Korean peninsula-shaped Bamseom. On the right side, you can hear the exciting shouts of those who descend on straw wires.
Skywalk on the Korean Peninsula
Get out of the skywalk and follow the promenade for a zipwire ride. Zipwire is a leports that glides by using a pulley connecting 1.1km to Gwanghari Eco Experience Center below. It's embarrassing to just sit still, but you have to courageously fly down 120km per hour.
Straw wire going down the Korean Peninsula
If you take a deep breath and step toward the air, the Korean peninsula will come to you. The person who screamed at first even opens his arms in about 20 seconds and welcomes the wind and the scenery.
Straw wire freely falling under the cool river

item.title: Pyeongchang-gun, Gangwon, South Korea - 2018 Pyeongchang Tourist Road 10, road trip along the river, along the mountain, along the taste
item.description:
Nami Island with trees stretching straight into the sky

2018 Pyeongchang Tourist Road 10, road trip along the river, along the mountain, along the taste

Pyeongchang-gun, Gangwon, South Korea

<Travel Course>
Chuncheon Nami Island → Chuncheon Charcoal Grilled Chicken Ribs

→ Wonju Museum Mountain → Pyeongchang Bongpyeongjang

→ Muyi Art Museum

The road trip in Gangwon-do is lyrical. When viewed from a distance, it has a river that seems to stop and sparkle and a museum that resembles a calm river. The place where people gather along the river naturally stands and is full of food. That's why my trip is full of excitement. Let's go on a road trip to Gangwon-do, where you can travel like a river and fill your heart and enjoy the taste.
Road trip begins at Nami Island floating on the Bukhan River. Travelers are famous for the drama 'Winter Sonata' and become accustomed to it. The attraction of Nami Island is that it makes you feel as if you have traveled abroad in Korea. So I don't know if it's called Naminara. There are two ways to enter Nami Island. 5 minutes by boat, or a straw wire, 30-40 km per hour to fly in 1 minute 30 seconds.
The most popular metasequoia road on Nami Island
Stepping into the Republic of Naminara, you will see a forest of trees stretching high into the sky. If you walk along the cool shade, you will find a picture book playground, a restaurant, Metasequoia Road, and a hotel Jeonggwanru. You can walk as slowly as you can, or rent a bicycle or electric car to explore every corner. Cycling rides along the Metasequoia Road, Fir Road, Ginkgo Road and Birch Road in the wind, and the summer heat is forgotten.
Bicycles are an important means of transportation on Nami Island
The place where many tourists are attracted is the location of Winter Sonata. The metasequoia road, which looks like a scene from a foreign movie, and the place where Bae Yong-jun and Choi Ji-woo make and kiss a snowman are essential courses for lovers who dream of a romantic trip.
If you are with your children, I recommend you to stop by the picture book playground where picture books are placed on a large bookshelf that extends up to the ceiling of the second floor. There are more than 20,000 children's books on the first floor, and there are more than 5,000 picture books from 86 countries on the second floor.
Drama Winter Sonata is the theme of Nami Island's eternal love
Also remember that Nami Island has a tomb of General Nami. Nami Island was originally a land belonging to Chuncheon City, and it became an island when the Cheongpyeong Dam was built in 1944. Nami spent his life in exile in Nami Island, reversing the conspiracy as a mother of Yu Ja-gwang. Today's tomb is a mystery, and the actual tomb is in Hwaseong, Gyeonggi-do.
Cool motorboat running across the water
If you know that Nami Island is in Chuncheon, you should put chicken ribs in your itinerary. "If you come to Chuncheon do not eat chicken ribs does not mean come to Chuncheon," remember the saying of the travelers. There are many restaurants that display 'Chuncheon Chicken Ribs' sign everywhere in the big city, but it's not comparable to eating in Chuncheon. You will have to try Chuncheon Chicken Ribs before moving on to other destinations. Chuncheon chicken ribs are two kinds. There are chicken ribs grilled over charcoal and grilled chicken ribs with plenty of vegetables on the iron plate. The beginning of Chuncheon Chicken Ribs was to grill on charcoal, but with the spread of thick teppanyaki, the teppanyaki style became popular.
Chicken Ribs Cooked on Sizzling Grill
Chicken rib shops on the Nami Island marina are grilled with chicken, vegetables, and rice cakes on an iron plate. Its spicy and sweet taste makes it popular with foreign tourists. If you want to eat roasted chicken ribs over charcoal, you should go to Sinbuk-eup. Any type of chicken ribs wrapped in lettuce with plenty of meat and vegetables, and served with Makguksu will complete Chuncheon's delicacy.
Chicken ribs and makguksu are a combination of fantasy
The road bends and heads to Mt. Wonju Museum. Cross the hill to the sky and pass through the birch forest path to see the picturesque Museum Mt. The scene looks like a fairy tale scene or a private garden of a rich man in Europe. With the design of world-class architect Tadao Ando, light, water, stone, nature and architecture blend together as a work of art.
Each line of the building looks like a work of art
The water garden filled with calm water has a Seosan Haemistone on the floor that turns black when it touches the water. The calm water contains the sky, so the steps leading to the entrance of the exhibition hall seem to be walking in the air. Walk slowly and admire the formation of the lines and sculptures of the building reflected in the water depending on the angle of light. There is a work by James Turrell who works on the theme of light. It is an exhibition where you can experience a new perspective on light and space.
The water garden of Mt.Museum containing the sky
When talking about Pyeongchang, Lee Hyo-seok's novel `` When Buckwheat Peel '' is indispensable. The buckwheat blossoms, which wander around the country in fiction, are so beautiful that the buckwheat blossoms bloomed in beauty.
If you want to see the buckwheat's flesh, go to Bongpyeongjang.
There is a Bongpyeongjang that is the background of the novel. It is a permanent market, but on the day of the month 2 and 7, the oil market opens and the market is noisy. It is true that Bongpyeongjang, which has a 400-year history, has been in decline since the times changed. However, the local people joined forces to preserve the tradition and renovated. Tents and aprons were made by colorizing five items, agricultural products, seafood, food, clothing, and sundries. The merchants also made displays and made plates that marked the country of origin for the customers to see. Proud to show off signs and business cards with a merchant's face. On the day of the oil stand, there are about 100 shops, and there are many buckwheat restaurants near Bongpyeongjang.
Bongpyeongjang filled with buckwheat food and the smell of crowded people
Even on rainy days, you can have fun moving between tents and tents while listening to the sound of rain falling under the hood. Yega-Chef's hand-drip coffee, or a bowl of rice wine with buckwheat pancakes, can be tasted only at Bongpyeongjang.
Bongpyeong oil stand stands on the day of the 2nd and 7th every month
You can't miss buckwheat food from Bongpyeongjang. Buckwheat is grown throughout Gangwon-do, but buckwheat has become a modifier of Bongpyeong. Like the buckwheat, Bongpyeong has various buckwheat foods such as soba noodles, buckwheat pancake, buckwheat jelly, buckwheat pancake and soba liquor.
Buckwheat is famous for its variety.
On the day of the oil stand, there are many shops selling buckwheat pans and sorghum buckwheat inside the market. Kimchi, vermicelli, pork, vegetables, etc. are put in thinly buckwheat buckwheat before making it.
Cold buckwheat blows off summer heat
Soba noodles served with spicy fresh kimchi with garnish and sprinkled with sesame salt with plenty of vegetables, are popular with both young grandchildren and elderly grandmothers.
Rice cake and hand drip coffee
Mui-Art Gallery is 10 minutes away from Bongpyeongjang. Four artists, sculptor, potter, calligrapher, renovated Muyi Elementary School, which was closed. On the playground, where students played, there are green grass and about 100 sculptures by artist Oh Sang Wook. The interior of the school is filled with sculptures and exhibits, just like students arranged works in the hallway after the art class.
Muyi Art Museum
The sound of the squeaky wooden floor and the squeaky wood windows is soed every step of the way. The classroom was an exhibition hall where the artist's work was exhibited, and an open studio of the artist in full swing, so that you can meet the present and future of Bongpyeong art. If you are a young child with a mobile phone ring, fan making, print experience (group booking), you can leave new memories and souvenirs.
Art that fills the hallway
Go up to the second floor and there is a terrace where you can relax. It is a structure that protrudes slightly at one end of the school and has a great view overlooking the wide lawn and statues.
Elementary school classroom transformed into artist's studio and exhibition hall

Recommended travel season: summer and autumn

Recommended trip: family, friends, lovers

item.title: Jeongseon-gun, Gangwon, South Korea - The beauty of native flowers that even spring virgins will cry for
item.description:
Donggang Pasqueflower Reveals Fascinating Flowers

The beauty of native flowers that even spring virgins will cry for

Jeongseon-gun, Gangwon, South Korea

The river, which flows around the rocky cliffs of Jeongseon and Pyeongchang, is a spot where people of all seasons stop because of the clear stream of snow and the surrounding scenery that unfolds for a moment. But the most exciting time for Donggang is spring. This is because Donggang Pasqueflower, a Korean plant, blooms in the limestone rocks. Let's leave now to see this flower that blooms from mid-March to April.
"Even young, pasqueflower, old age!"

The traditional nursery rhyme “Ghalmi Flower” has a simple song that shows our emotion well.

‘Invigorating flower in the back garden, white-tailed pale-flowered flower, young and old pale-flowered flower, even when it is old, … ’

The pasqueflower, though, is still so beautiful that the tears fall into tears. But why is it called 'Halmiflower'? There are very sad stories about the name of the pasqueflower. In the old days, there was a grandmother who lived with two granddaughters in Dumesan Valley. The granddaughter was pretty but ill and nasty. In time, the granddaughter became a rich man in a neighboring village, and the little granddaughter was married to a poor farmer over the mountain. In time, the old and sick grandmother visited her granddaughter, but soon afterwards she was driven out. He lived beyond the mountain to find a little granddaughter, who tried to die to the ridge, but he could not endure the cold and hunger on his sick body. A little granddaughter rushed over to hear the news and buried her grandmother in her place. People called the paschal flower because it was the grandmother's soul.
Donggang Pasqueflower White and Pink Flower
Contrary to this sad story, it is actually called a pasqueflower because the flower cover covered with white hair is bent and the pistil after the flower swells resembles an old man with white hair. In oriental medicine, pasqueflower roots are used as a Buddhist temple called Baekduong.
A flower that has closed petals under the influence of wind or the environment
In Korea, about 10 species, including yellow pale flowers, pink pale flowers and fine leaf pale flowers, grow wild and all have strong toxicity. Once upon a time, from the spring to the fall, the roots of pasqueflower were dug up and sprinkled with raw and boiled water on conventional toilets, where they were used as insecticides to kill insects.
Donggang Pasqueflower Blooming in Fan Shape
Spring in Gangwon-do begins with Donggang Pasqueflower
After the first thunder and the sound of bugs awakening from a long hibernation, a light chip (Spring-March 5 or 6) passes and Donggang Paschal blooms. Unlike Pasqueflower, which grows mainly in sunny graveyards, Donggang Pasqueflower is rooted in the crevices of limestone cliffs along the river. In addition, it is usually characterized by the comfort of the flower without bending it. It is a perennial plant where the first buds bloom and the first flowers bloom, and two flowers bloom in the following year, and the flowers increase as the years go on. It grows to about the height of an adult's hand and is covered with soft fluffy wool. The flowers are usually pinkish in color but vary in bluish purple, reddish purple and white, and bloom in various colors at the root.
A rocky cliff on the bank of Donggang, where Donggang Pasqueflower grows
In fact, those who lived in the Donggang called this flower “pale flower”. This is the story that got the cool name of “Donggang pale flowers”. In the spring of 1998, plant photographer Kim Jung-myung took an ecological picture back up the Donggang, discovered the flower and announced it to the world for the first time through a calendar of his own photos. It was revealed by Dr. Lee Young-no, a researcher of the Korea Institute of Plant Research, who, after the research, turned out to be a Korean specialty plant found only in the Donggang region. As a result, Pulsatilla tongkangensis Y.N. Lee et T.C. Lee has become a rare and special flower that shows its habitat, Donggang.
Scenery with a tandem house and a river
At that time, Donggang Pasqueflower was a strong opposition to the government's policy of building the Donggang Dam, and added enormous power to the environmental groups and the local people who made efforts to revive the Donggang River. The construction plan of the Donggang Dam was finally blanked in June 2000 by the low-level forces that introduced Donggang Pasqueflower, a Korean plant. This has led many to become interested in ecological and natural environment issues, and it is true that efforts for conservation and protection have taken place like wildfire. Numerous East River flora and fauna, and limestone caves, which are almost likely to be buried, all owe a great debt to Donggang Pasqueflower.
Donggang pasqueflower native area adjacent to the road
Donggang Pasqueflower preservation first place person
Donggang Pasqueflower survived the crisis and survived, but the following times were not smooth. With better traffic and more widespread use of high-performance digital cameras, fellow hobbyists came to the swarms to visit the Donggang Pasqueflower habitat, causing some damage, while some ignorant people took photographs to remove all the stems and leaves that are essential for hydration and survival of flowers. After taking a photo, he even went to the endangered species, committing a brutality to cut flowers at all. This is not only the case. Natural disaster also played a part. This is due to the huge typhoons “Rusa” and “Cicada” that followed in August 2002 and September 2003. Park Jae-yeol, the director of Gyul-Am-ri Village, tells the situation at that time.
“Then the river suffered a lot of damage. The level of the Donggang in front of the village has risen to a record high, and most of the Donggang Pasqueflower rooted in the ridges here are uprooted and washed down, reducing the number of people noticeably. ”
Dandelion, a nice flower we met at Donggang Pasqueflower native
In the midst of the crisis, the people who pulled their arms together for the preservation of Donggang Pasqueflower are the residents of Gyulam-ri called Donggang Pasqueflower Village. Since 2005, the village residents have formed the Donggang Pasqueflower Conservation Society, which has become a member, and have been seeding them for 10 years. At the same time, the “Donggang Pasqueflower Festival” is held in April every year, and the festival has already reached 10 times this year. On April 1 (Friday) to 3 (Sunday), the 10th Donggang Pasqueflower Festival, held at the Donggang Ecological Experience Center in Gul-Am-ri, is home to a variety of exhibitions, food fairs, and traditional games. The paschal flower is announced and the thought sharing for preservation continues.
Pussy willow
In Gangwon-do, the government has also made efforts to conserve the Donggang ecosystem, including the Donggang Pasqueflower. Every two to three years, a natural rest year was proclaimed in Donggang. Its content is to control access to the valley by June 15 so that the animals and plants that live in the Donggang River can bloom, seed, and lay eggs. Naturally, rafting is also prohibited at this time. This year is the year when the natural rest year is enforced. To overcome many crises, the Donggang Pasqueflower left by us, sprouting in the cracks of the rocks, washing our faces in the blue Donggang, and lovingly and caring for the beautiful flowers that live on our side, we must strengthen our efforts for conservation. It's up to us all to buy it.
Jeongseon Swordweed called Donggang Goren near the Donggang Pasqueflower
▶ The Ministry of Culture, Sports and Tourism and the Korea Tourism Organization are continuously pursuing projects to discover and nurture areas where our wildflowers, such as Jeongseon Donggang-gil, can be activated as local tourism resources. to be.
Topography of the Korean Peninsula overlooked from the Byeongchibyeong Observatory

item.title: Sokcho, Gangwon, South Korea - Go catch Pokemon! Pokemon Go in Sokcho
item.description:
View from Sokcho Lighthouse Observatory

Go catch Pokemon! Pokemon Go in Sokcho

Sokcho, Gangwon, South Korea

In the summer of 2016, the Pokemon Go craze is not unusual. Pokemon Go is not yet officially released in Korea, but games are available in Sokcho, Gangwon-do and some surrounding areas. As this fact became known, Sokcho stood as 'Pokemon Holy Land'. Those who want to catch Pokemon flocked to Sokcho from all over the country. Sokcho buses were sold out, and a quick travel agency also offered travel packages to catch Pokemon. Let's take a look around playing Sokcho and Pokémon Go games that are screaming with the holiday season.
Sokcho, located between Goseong and Yangyang, Gangwon-do, has mountains, lakes, and sea as well as geographical advantages within two hours from the metropolitan area. Why don't you take a more meticulous trip to Sokcho with this Pokemon hunting? If you don't forget to lift your head to the reality behind the phone, it will be a trip to Pokémon holding Pokemon and Sokcho. Be careful about safety accidents.
Pokemon Go, are you?
In Pokemon Go, monsters appear in places where many people actually go. Since Pokemon is one of the most popular destinations, you need to know the local hotspots to meet many Pokemon. In the same vein, Sokcho's 11 most visited sites are the most popular tourist attractions of Sokcho. Among them are the Jangjang, where the bare-handed squid festival is in full swing.
I confess before I start catching a real monster. The reporter does not know the game. I've played Tetris games and have no interest in games or hobbies. The words augmented reality can only sound alien. I didn't understand why I was so enthusiastic that it was difficult to download the Pokemon Go app under the Korean account.
Augmented Reality Pokemon Go with 3D Graphics
Augmented Reality (AR) refers to a technology that displays computer-generated 3D graphics on a visible environment. In other words, if you run Pokemon Go, you will see the environment as if you were taking a picture, and monsters would appear on it. Then throw the monster ball to catch the Pokemon. Of course, it's not as easy as it sounds.
Augmented Reality Pokemon Go with 3D Graphics
Pokemon Go is a location-based game of Google Maps on your smartphone that requires monsters to enter a specific area. South Korea is missing here, but some survived and the Pokemon Go game was executed. That is Gangwon Sokcho and some surrounding areas. In addition to Sokcho, two other Pokemon Go viable areas, including Ulleung and Ulju-gun, Gyeongbuk are being discovered.
33-year-old office workers run from Seoul to Sokcho
Pokemon Go base camp, Sokcho, Expo Tower Park
In Sokcho, the sacred place of Pokemon, the center of Pokemon Go is Cheongcho Lake and Expo Tower Park. Wi-Fi maps and free smartphone charging are also available. Most of all, Pokémon seduces the hunters (?) So that you can take the Cheongcho Lake Expo Tower as a base camp and explore Abai Village, Sokcho Tourist Fish Market, Dongmyeong Port and Sokcho Beach.
Three generations of Pokemon Go
For us, Abai Village, famous for filming the drama "Autumn Fairy Tales", is a collective settlement of displaced people. Originally it was a place where few people lived, but when refugees gathered during the Korean War, a village was formed. There are many specialty shops where you can taste the Sunbuk style. Abai Village (Cheongho-dong) and Jungang-dong are located in a quiet place. Sokcho Tourist Fish Market, famous for Chicken Gangjeong and Alley of Chicken, is also considered a Pokemon hot spot. When you go to the market, take a good look around, and remember the meeting center in the basement of the fish market.
Abai Village where refugees were displaced during the Korean War
The next destination is the same name port. Let's go up to the lighthouse observatory that is Sokcho's proud view point. When the weather is good, you can see Sokcho city, as well as Sokcho Beach and Oeongchi Beach. Don't miss the Sokcho sea view from Yeonggeumjeong Observation Deck.
North Sokcho Port Details
If you go north from Dongmyeong Port, it is a Jangjeo, and if you go south, Sokcho Beach. First, let's go to the market where the squid man-handed festival is held until July 31. Squid fishing is in full swing along the small beach. Enjoy a short walk to the lighthouse with Pokemon.
genus
Sokcho Beach is now. You can enjoy exciting bathing on the fine sandy beach. Here, too, face those who came to catch Pokemon.
Young people from Busan to play Pokemon Go
The seven-year-old kid from Seoul was more engaged in games than swimming. Young people from Seoul and Busan were also busy catching monsters.
7 year old kid from Seoul
If you are uncomfortable with Sokcho Beach, head to Oeongchi Beach.
Sokcho beach view
In both directions, so if you keep the sea on your left and go down, you will reach outland. You can enjoy swimming in a relatively quiet sea.
Sokcho beach view
If you stop at Daepo Port, you will see all the monsters on the coast. Now let's go to Seoraksan.
Road to Mt. Geumseong by Seoraksan Cable Car
Seoraksan is known as an unexpected Pokemon Haunting Area. It is often called Seorak in Sokcho area, and it is enough to take a cable car to look at Kwon Geumseong and look at Sinheungsa, an obscene music inspector. Shinheungsa was founded in 652 by the ruler named Hyangseongsa.
Seoraksan Sinheungsa Temple

Throughout the wait for the cable car, people were busy catching Pokemon. I could not see the face of Mt. Sorak in the thick fog, but it was obvious that it was a different experience. Rumors that there is a Pokemon in Everest will not be rumored. Some even go out of the boat to catch rare Pokemon. In all cases, don't forget it's a safety first. Pokemon Go's completion is a safe return.

Due to the Pokemon Go craze, Sokcho City began providing the integrated Pokemon Go online map on the City Hall website (www.sokcho.gangwon.kr) on July 26th. The integrated map, based on Google Maps, shows 8 locations of Sokcho tours, including the location of the `` Pocket Stop '' charging station, Pokemon training and combat space `` Pokemon Go Gymnasium '', and a free battery charging station. If you have a Pokemon Go hunting plan, you should check the benefits to the game users. If you catch 30 Pokémon by August 8, you can visit Sokcho City Museum for free.

item.title: "This place in Wonju!" Industrial tourism connecting chocolate, nature, medical equipment, kitchenware, cosmetics
item.description:
Coffee trees grow when you enter <The Chocolate Empress>.

"This place in Wonju!" Industrial tourism connecting chocolate, nature, medical equipment, kitchenware, cosmetics

Wonju, Gangwon, South Korea

The village of Wonju, the gateway to Gangwon-do and the name of Gangwon-do. It is home to the island river and Ganhyeon Amusement Park, boasting clear waters, including Chiaksan (1288m), a large mountain in Yeongseo. Today, I will travel to find a different expression of Wonju. The name is a bit unfamiliar, but if you know it, the fun is 'Industrial Tourism'. Introducing experience-based tours and industrial tourism hotspots for families.
#One. Gather everyone who likes chocolate! Chocolate Empress
Chocolate Empress (CEO Jang Ji-eun), located in Haenggu-dong, Wonju-si, is a restaurant specializing in fermentation chocolate that adds special taste and efficacy to chocolate. Naturally fermented chocolate made after 12 years of investment is matured in Onggi for at least 3 days to give a deep taste.
The building of Chocolate Empress, called Sontak Hotel, is a space for making fermented chocolate and fermented beverages, as well as a cafe, laboratory, and experience space where you can taste them. If you go to this place, you can find a mysterious chocolate that can be stored for more than 100 days by fermentation aging without additives.
There is an experience program for both children and adults. In addition to making bear fermented chocolate for kids 4 to 6 years old (40 ~ 60 minutes, 18,000 won per person) and making cacao cake balls for more than kindergarten students (40 ~ 60 minutes, 15,000 won per person) , Making petals fermented chocolate that can be experienced by elementary school students (60 ~ 90 minutes, 25,000 won per person) and chocolate fondue (30 minutes, 10,000 won per person), cacao cake bar (about 30 minutes, 1 person 1 person) 15,000 won).
Raw chocolate can be stored for a long time by natural fermentation
Many people are also looking for a hand drip coffee experience (90 minutes, 25,000 won per person) for high school students and older. All programs can be applied for more than 4 people. Reservation required one day in advance.
Melting chocolate to make brownies

▶ 16, Gomungol-gil, Wonju-si, Gangwon-do / Sontak Cafe / 033-765-7306 (weekdays)

www.chocohwanghu.co.kr

'Brownie Making Experience' at <The Chocolate Empress>
#2. Healing of body and mind, <Wonju Herb Farm>
Wonju Herb Farm (CEO, Cha Seong-hwan), proud of Wonju, Gangwon-do. Nearly 1,000 species of plants are growing in various gardens and ponds, including rose gardens, livestock gardens, training gardens, indoor gardens, and herb bath gardens.
Main building where you can find herbal drinks, food and products
In particular, the night view and herb foot bath in the colorful garden with thousands of LED lights are popular as a date course of Wonju. The herb foot bath that cats welcome is added to the fee (1000 won).
Ponds filled with outdoor gardens
Wonju Herb Farm is largely divided into indoor buildings and outdoor spaces. The plant museum described above fills the outdoor space, while the three-story building houses cafes, restaurants, and herb shops. You can taste herbal teas, herbal ice cream, herbal pork cutlet and bibimbap, offering a variety of herbal experiences to those looking for Wonju Herb Farm.
Cha Seong-hwan, Director of the Plant
▶ 887-24, Musil-dong, Wonju-si, Gangwon-do / 033-762-3113 / 10: 00 ~ 22: 00 (Closed on Mondays) / Adults 7,000 won, middle and high school students 6000 won, preferential 5,000 won (wonwon citizens 1,000 won discount)
Cha Seong-hwan, Director of the Plant
# 3. Everything in life medical devices! <Wonju Medical Device Support Center>
Wonju Medical Device Support Center, known as Asia's first medical device permanent exhibition. The question of 'what is the place to do' is quickly resolved by visiting the medical device permanent exhibition in Wonju Medical Device Techno Valley.
Medical Device Development Theme Center located in Medical Device Support Center
The most interesting place for visitors is the ‘Sales Zone’. Various medical devices as well as living and beauty devices are on display and sold. In addition to functional cosmetics, it adds variety and is attractive because it can be purchased at a lower price than commercially available.
beauty
It is difficult to see the weekend because of the renewal of the company booth until early July 2015. Anyone can watch from 10 am to 5 pm on weekdays. If you make a reservation in advance, you can add an explanation from the staff of the administration office. The company plans to hold a special exhibition twice a year in spring and autumn. It is useful because you can see and experience useful home care products at home, and then buy them cheaply.
Visitors testing skin condition
▶ 200, Corporate City, Wonju-si, Gangwon-do / 033-760-6100 (Permanent Exhibition), 033-900-5888 (Office) / 10: 00 ~ 17: 00 (Weekends are not available until July 3rd due to corporate booth renewal)
Visitors in Paraffin Bath Experience
#4. <Neoflam> full of colorful eco-friendly kitchen utensils
Neo-Flam (CEO Park Chang-soo), a company specializing in eco-friendly kitchen products, loved by housewives, newlyweds, and self-employed students, built a new nest in Wonju Enterprise City. Neo-Flam, famous for its colorful kitchen utensils, is a combination of 'neo' and 'flam'. Eco-friendly ceramic coated kitchen utensils are attracting the attention of modern people.
Unfortunately, it is difficult to personally visit the Neoflam factory. So far, only groups of 40 or more are available for field trips. You can see a series of products produced in the open factory with transparent windows, and you can also watch and purchase them in the showroom, where various products of Neoflam are displayed. As it is purchased in the field, it can be purchased at a lower price than commercially available. The showroom, which offers pretty kitchen utensils, is impressive.
<Neoflam> Wonju headquarters 1F lobby view
▶ 1 / 080-512-7000 / Group tour of 40 or more people
Neoflam is located in Wonju, both headquarters and factory
# 5. I know if you write a sample, <True Zone>
Charmzone (CEO Kwang-seok Kim), which has been established as a professional cosmetics company for more than 30 years, is headquartered in Gangnam, Seoul, and a factory in Wonju. The Wonju factory exhibits not only cosmetics laboratories, production plants but also the history of Charmzone.
View of Wonju Plant in <Chamzone>
If you want to visit the factory, you must make a reservation by phone. You must wait at least two years from the time of booking.
The tour of the factory begins with the history of
Up to 24 people can apply at once. Only two seasons are visited during the spring and fall seasons. Take the car prepared by the head office and move to Wonju factory.
Factory where you can see the cosmetic production process
Cosmetics that show the history of Charmzone at a glance

▶ 58, Taejanggongdan-ro, Wonju-si, Gangwon-do / 080-022-0204

item.title: Looking for a gourmet restaurant in Wonju traditional market that is eccentric and twice as tasty
item.description:
Wonju Kimchi dumplings

Looking for a gourmet restaurant in Wonju traditional market that is eccentric and twice as tasty

Wonju, Gangwon, South Korea

Wonju, the city you will meet when you run the Yeongdong Expressway towards the East Sea. I found hidden fun in Wonju, which I thought was a passing city. It is located in every corner of the Central Market. It is also fun to visit the Jungjung Traditional Market facing the Central Market and the Pungmul Market every 2 and 7 days. Loosen the belts when looking around the market.

Delicious and inexpensive, Wonju Central Market
If you're very hungry, or wondering about the most famous restaurant in the Central Market, don't wander and visit Wonju Kimchi Dumpling (033-745-3848). This dumpling house has been for three generations for over 40 years.
The family that runs dumplings in the face of the handicapped has become more famous as it is introduced in TV documentaries. Not to mention the taste of dumplings. The guests who filled the dining table reassure the first visitor.
The lady who was introduced to a TV program and became a celebrity
The representative menu of this house is Kalmandu. It is a hearty menu of kalguksu and dumplings. It's good to have your own kalguksu noodles, but the texture of dumplings with plenty of cabbage kimchi is incomparable to any other dumplings in other regions.
Kal dumplings to taste both kalguksu
If you want to taste the dumplings, order kimchi dumplings boiled in boiling water. The thick but chewy dumplings and the crispy dumplings are in harmony, so your hands keep going even though you are full.
Warm kimchi dumplings
Fried dumplings fried with freshly made dumplings are also special.
Crispy Fried Dumplings
Buckwheat jeon, which is made of thin buckwheat dough with Chinese cabbage and green onions, is a food often encountered while visiting Wonju's market. The buckwheat jeon, which can never be imitated without the grandmother's hands, is a taste of Gangwon-do, with a light taste and simple emotion.
Buckwheat noodle made with grandma's taste
The price is good with just 1,000 won for 2-3 pieces. Buckwheat Buckwheat (033-745-1644) is one of the most praised buckwheat collections.
Buckwheat jeon tasted in the rural marketplace of Gangwon-do becomes a memory
Many young people visit the Central Market because they are connected to the street of Jung-dong Culture called Myeong-dong. The free market next to the central market is a modern mall. If you go down to the first floor, there are small restaurants that sell Korean representative snacks, Tteokbokki, Tempura, and Sundae. There are restaurants in the form of seats, but there are signboards such as Friendship House, Tonere, and Friendly Tteokbokki.
Tteokbokki Town, B1, Free Market
If you order one serving, you can mix various tempura with Tteokbokki according to your taste. Soup with a piece of fish paste is a service. It is a spot where light students eat and chatter.
Tteokbokki and tempura mixed with spicy sauce
On the opposite side of the underground passage there was one restaurant waiting in line.
Entrance to 'Hard home wherever you find'
Does it mean that it is hard to find in the corner of the basement? Or does it mean that it's hard to find a restaurant like this? 'Hard home to find it' (033-745-0031) is a place where you can taste special cutlet. If you eat it with spicy rice balls or spicy rice balls or tteokbokki, it's a great meal. Pork cuts are ground twice a day and fried at the same time as the order. Kim Don is made of rice balls topped with neat pork cutlet and spicy kimchi toppings. You can have several different menus. Kodonburo is also a popular dish, with fried cheese and vegetables. The low price of less than 6,000 won is also attractive, but the interior of the café on the second floor of the attic is a great way to attract young people.
Pork cutlet and rice ball of 'Hard house to find no matter where you find'
On the other side of the passage is a snack shop, the newlyweds (033-745-8037). Here too, you should be prepared to wait in line at mealtime. Although it is famous for myeon, there are also a variety of meal menus such as dolsot bibimbap, omelet rice, and miscellaneous vegetables. The highest price is just 4,500 won. Don't doubt the taste.
Newlywed Couples Filled with Young Customers
Try a specialty hidden in a narrow alley, Jungwon Traditional Market
If you fill up your stomach and leave the Central Market, you will find the Jungwon Traditional Market. If the central market is the center of food, the Jungwon Traditional Market is lined with clothing and grocery stores, so it's easy to walk and watch.
Hanwoo Alley, which has been alive since late afternoon, is a spot in the Jungwon Traditional Market that everyone knows. After opening the door, there are about 10 restaurants lined up in a narrow alley where you can bump into the nose of someone coming out of the store. At first glance, it has a shabby appearance and few tables, but you need to make a reservation to settle down in the evening. It is popular because you can taste special parts such as Korean beef meat, insole meat at reasonable prices. It is a friendly alley where you can face a forehead on a small brazier and share a drink at a piece of meat.
Hanwoo Alley in Jungwon Traditional Market
If you step inside the Korean beef alley, you can taste the tadpoles. Corn paste, which has passed through a coarse sieve, is often introduced on TV as it falls into hot water and ripens into a tadpole.
Drain the water and put it in a jar
If you're curious about the taste, look for Grandmother's tadpole (033-743-6473). Season the tadpole noodles from the water with soy sauce and chopped kimchi with garnish. The sesame salt you put in to add sue adjusts to your taste.
'Grandmother tadpole' in the alley
In Wonju, it is not called tadpole noodles but tadpoles. The way of eating is similar to mukbap but does not use broth separately. Crunchy kimchi and soft ladle noodles are cool and light. If the weather gets cold, you can eat it warmly.
Tadpole noodles with kimchi garnish
The central passage is the alley. It is a place where you can taste all kinds of temples that are eaten during sacrifices and holidays.
'Delicacies' in Alleys
Meet every 5 days, the taste of Pungmul Market

If you find 2, 7 on the date you found Wonju, the visit to Pungmul Market is a bonus. You may plan a weekly outing on the day of the market. As Wonju was the largest market place in the Gangwon region, it is a market that inherits its traditions and gathers a variety of daily necessities including agricultural and marine products.

If you pass by today, let's meet the restaurants of Pungmul Market where you have to wait 5 days again. 'Jangterukbap' (033-734-7929) is a common restaurant that sells Sundae Gukbap and Kalguksu on days when there is no market, but it turns into a feast day after day. This is because buckwheat pancakes are made with buckwheat pancakes and mung bean pancakes. You can choose the food you want to eat in the restaurant.
Quail House, featuring food stalls
The quail-style “Quilt House” without a phone number grills various kinds of seafood such as squid, quails and skewers on a charcoal fire. Older seniors are hungry for simple snacks, but they offer a unique experience for travelers who go to oil field outings for unusual sights. It is also a tourist's privilege to take a leisurely tour of those who have gone out for shopping with a bowl of warm mussel bath.
Wholesale Shop Opening After Sale
